articles.content:
THE first person who died from the coronavirus in the U.S. passed from a ruptured heart caused by her bodys effort to defeat the virus, according to her autopsy.
Patricia Dowd, a 57-year-old from California, died on February 6 far earlier than the February 2… [+2840 chars]

articles.author: Ryan Smith
articles.title: Four more patients die after testing positive for coronavirus while in the care of Northumbria NHS trust with three more cases confirmed in county - Northumberland Gazette
articles.description: A further three patients have lost their lives after testing positive for coronavirus at the hospital trust which serves Northumberland as the number of cases in the county rose to 709.
articles.content:
The latest figures show 128 people have died in hospitals covered by Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust as of today, Monday, April 27.
In total, 938 people who had tested positive for coronavirus have died across the North Easts hospital trusts, an … [+3064 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Two new cases found in Powys - Powys County Times
articles.description: Two more cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Powys today, taking the total number in the county since the outbreak began to 154.
articles.content:
Two more cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Powys today, taking the total number in the county since the outbreak began to 154.
The number of people confirmed to have died in the county after contracting the disease remains at seven, Public Health W… [+928 chars]

articles.author: Alahna Kindred
articles.title: Coronavirus patients suffering ‘nasty red rash’ before Covid-19 symptoms - The Sun
articles.content:
A RED rash could be another symptom of coronavirus, experts have warned.
Data from Italy suggests as many as one in five people who are hospitalised with the killer bug may develop rashes or unexplained marks on their skin.

articles.description: Latest news on the search for a vaccine against the new coronavirus
articles.content:
As Covid-19 has rapidly spread around the world there has been a mad scramble to find a vaccine. 
In the UK on April 23, a potential coronavirus vaccine being developed at the University of Oxford began human trials.
